instruction: How effective were the machine learning algorithms in classifying snack samples based on qualitative aspects using near infrared spectroscopy?
Output: The machine learning algorithms, namely partial least squares discriminant analysis (PLS-DA), multilayer feed-forward of resilient backpropagation network (RPropMLP), and random forest (RF), were effective in classifying snack samples based on qualitative aspects using near infrared spectroscopy. The accuracy of the models was above 0.80 in each case, indicating a high level of effectiveness. The neural network-based algorithm, RPropMLP, outperformed the other algorithms in terms of accuracy and area under the ROC curve values, suggesting its potential advantage in handling smaller datasets. Overall, the results demonstrate that these machine learning algorithms can be successfully applied to the authentication and quality assurance of snack products.
